sentences.sentence_en: A total eclipse of the sun is a rare and spectacular event to witness.

sentences.sentence_en: She spent the whole afternoon baking delicious cookies for her friends and family.

sentences.sentence_en: Eating whole grains is much better for your digestive health than eating refined flour.

sentences.sentence_en: The whole team celebrated their victory with a big party at the local restaurant.

sentences.sentence_en: You need to look at the whole picture before making such a big decision.

sentences.sentence_en: After hours of work, I finally feel that the report is complete and ready.

sentences.sentence_en: He is a complete stranger to me, so I don't know if I can trust him.

sentences.sentence_en: A complete change of diet helped her recover from the illness much faster.

sentences.sentence_en: The lunar eclipse was only partial, so the moon was not completely covered.

sentences.sentence_en: She gave a partial answer to the question, avoiding the most controversial parts.

sentences.sentence_en: The caterpillar's body consists of many different segments that help it move easily.

sentences.sentence_en: The average attention span of a human has decreased because of digital distractions.

sentences.sentence_en: He finally managed to reach the summit of the mountain after a long, exhausting climb.

sentences.sentence_en: The restaurant menu offers a whole spectrum of dishes, from traditional to modern fusion.
